text: Narsee Monjee College of Commerce and Economics (commonly referred to as NM College) is a premier private educational institution in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. Affiliated with the University of Mumbai, it was established in 1964 by the Shri Vile Parle Kelavani Mandal (SVKM), a charitable trust aimed at promoting quality education. The college is known for its focus on commerce, management, and economics, and has consistently ranked among the top commerce institutions in India. == History == Narsee Monjee College of Commerce and Economics was founded in 1964 by the Shri Vile Parle Kelavani Mandal to meet the demand for quality commerce education in Mumbai. Named after the philanthropist Narsee Monjee, the college initially offered undergraduate courses in commerce. Over the years, it expanded to include various undergraduate and postgraduate courses in finance, accounting, business, and management. == References == == Other websites == * Category:1960s establishments in India Category:1964 establishments in Asia Category:Colleges and universities in India Category:Mumbai
title: Narsee Monjee College of Commerce and Economics
